verses.roman:
śrī-śuka uvāca
iti viklavitaṁ tāsāṁ
śrutvā yogeśvareśvaraḥ
prahasya sa-dayaṁ gopīr
ātmārāmo 'py arīramat

synonyms: śrī-śukaḥ uvāca—Śukadeva Gosvāmī said; iti—in these words; viklavitam—the despondent expressions of; tāsām—of them; śrutvā—having heard; yoga-īśvara-īśvaraḥ—the Lord of all lords of mystic power; prahasya—laughing; sa-dayam—mercifully; gopīḥ—the gopīs; ātma ārāmaḥ—self-satisfied; api—even though; arīramat—He satisfied.
translation: Śukadeva Gosvāmī said: Smiling upon hearing these despondent words from the gopīs, Lord Kṛṣṇa, the supreme master of all masters of mystic yoga, mercifully enjoyed with them, although He is self-satisfied.
